body_html:
I believe the TF team is compiling 1.12.0 for Cuda 9.2. Maybe there's some incompatibility with TF1.12 and Cuda 9.1?? I'm not sure your specific issue but I have a similar setup and I'm using Cuda 10.0 (and the associated cuDNN 7.3.1) installed from the official NVidia download, see Cuda 10. I've had issues in the past installing earlier gcc versions to overcome the Cuda compatibility issues. This package is setup for 18.04 and so it works with gcc 7.0 (the default compiler). No need to install gcc 6.

For my Ubuntu 18.04 (python3 and bazel 18) with Cuda 10.0 with TF 1.12.0 compiling for source worked great.

body:
I believe the TF team is compiling 1.12.0 for Cuda 9.2.  Maybe there's some incompatibility with TF1.12 and Cuda 9.1??  I'm not sure your specific issue but I have a similar setup and I'm using Cuda 10.0 (and the associated cuDNN 7.3.1) installed from the official NVidia download, see [Cuda 10](https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-downloads?target_os=Linux&target_arch=x86_64&target_distro=Ubuntu&target_version=1804).  I've had issues in the past installing earlier gcc versions to overcome the Cuda compatibility issues.  This package is setup for 18.04 and so it works with gcc 7.0 (the default compiler).  No need to install gcc 6.

For my Ubuntu 18.04 (python3 and bazel 18) with Cuda 10.0 with TF 1.12.0 compiling for source worked great.
